ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: In total, how long have you received any form of mental health services?
Notes: 0 = Less than 1 year; 1 = One year or more but less than five years; 2 = Between five and ten years; 3 = More than ten years

ElementDescription: Which of the following statements is MOST TRUE for you? (Check only one)
Notes: 0 = I have never heard of, or thought about, recovery from psychiatric disability; 1 = I do not believe I have any need to recover from psychiatric problems; 2 = I have not had the time to really consider recovery; 3 = I''ve been thinking about recovery, but haven''t decided to move on it yet; 4 = I am committed to my recovery, and am making plans to take action very soon; 5 = I am actively involved in the process of recovery from psychiatric disability; 6 = I was actively moving toward recovery, but now I''m not because...; 7 = I feel that I am fully recovered; I just have to maintain my gains; 8 = Other (specify)

ElementDescription: If ree001 = 6, complete the following: I was actively moving toward recovery but now I am not because...
If ree001 = 8, complete the following: Other (specify)
What kind of services are you currently receiving in that program? (check in all that apply): self-help or consumer-run services
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes
